citation.article-title: Taxonomic re-evaluation of 'Nocardiopsis' sp. K-252T (= NRRL 15532T): a proposal to transfer this strain to the genus Nonomuraea as Nonomuraea longicatena sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Nonomuraea longicatena sp. nov.
Nonomuraea longicatena (lon.gi.ca.te'na. L. adj. longi -long; L. n. catena chain; longicatena long chain, referring to long spore chains)
Spore chains straight, curved, or irregular spiral with rows of 10-30 spores on aerial hyphae.
Spores ovoid to cylindrical with a smooth surface.
Oatmeal agar (ISP no.3): poor growth, white aerial mycelium, colourless to ochre substrate mycelium, no diffusible pigment.
Yeast extract/malt extract agar (ISP no. 2): abundant growth, white aerial mycelium, ochre substrate mycelium, pale yellow diffusible pigment.
Inorganic salt/starch agar (ISP no.4): poor to moderate growth, white aerial mycelium, parchment substrate mycelium, no diffusible pigment.

D-Glucose, D-ribose, L-rhamnose, trehalose, adonitol, glycerol and inosotol are utilized as sole carbon sources but D-arabinose, L-arabinose, D-xylose, cellobiose, galactose, inulin, lactose, maltose, raffinose, salicin, sucrose, dulcitol and mannitol are not.
Casein, elastin, hypoxanthin and tyrosine are degraded but DNA, gelatin and xanthine are not.
Grows in the presence of up to 3% NaCl.
The G+C content of the DNA is 71.7 mol%.
